         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/1-85359-204-8" title="Special:BookSources/1-85359-204-8">1-85359-204-8</a></li> 
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFShen1996" class="citation book cs1">Shen, Raphael (1996). <i>Ukraine's Economic Reform: Obstacles, Errors, Lessons</i>. Praeger/Greenwood. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-275-95240-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-275-95240-2"><bdi>978-0-275-95240-2</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Ukraine%27s+Economic+Reform%3A+Obstacles%2C+Errors%2C+Lessons&amp;rft.pub=Praeger%2FGreenwood&amp;rft.date=1996&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-275-95240-2&amp;rft.aulast=Shen&amp;rft.aufirst=Raphael&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUkraine" class="Z3988"></span></li> 
        <li>Whitmore, Sarah. <i>State Building in Ukraine: The Ukrainian Parliament, 1990–2003</i> Routledge, 2004 <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.questia.com/read/108557869/state-building-in-ukraine-the-ukrainian-parliament">online edition</a></li> 
        <li><a href="/wiki/Andrew_Wilson_(historian)" title="Andrew Wilson (historian)">Wilson, Andrew</a>, <i>Ukraine's Orange Revolution</i> (2005)</li> 
        <li>Wilson, Andrew, <i>The Ukrainians: Unexpected Nation,</i> 2nd ed. 2002; <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.amazon.com/gp/reader/0300093098?p=S00L">online excerpts at Amazon</a></li> 
        <li>Wilson, Andrew, <i>Ukrainian Nationalism in the 1990s: A Minority Faith</i>, <a href="/wiki/Cambridge_University_Press" title="Cambridge University Press">Cambridge University Press</a>, 
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-521-57457-9" title="Special:BookSources/0-521-57457-9">0-521-57457-9</a></li> 
        <li>Zon, Hans van. <i>The Political Economy of Independent Ukraine</i>. 2000 <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.questia.com/read/98833788/the-political-economy-of-independent-ukraine">online edition</a></li>
       </ul> 
      </div> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="History_2">History</span></h3> 
      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1004355016">
      <div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em"> 
       <ul>
        <li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.academia.edu/10220788/UKRAINIAN_UPPER_PALAEOLITHIC_BETWEEN_40_10.000_BP">UKRAINIAN UPPER PALAEOLITHIC BETWEEN 40/10.000 BP</a></li> 
        <li>Bilinsky, Yaroslav <i>The Second Soviet Republic: The Ukraine after World War II</i> (<a href="/wiki/Rutgers_University_Press" title="Rutgers University Press">Rutgers University Press</a>, 1964) <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.questia.com/read/98757892/the-second-soviet-republic-the-ukraine-after-world">online</a></li> 
        <li>Hrushevsky, Michael. <i>A History of Ukraine</i> (1986)</li> 
        <li>Katchanovski Ivan; Kohut, Zenon E.; Nebesio, Bohdan Y.; and Yurkevich, Myroslav. <i>Historical Dictionary of Ukraine.</i> Second Edition. Scarecrow Press, 2013. 968 pp.</li> 
        <li>Kononenko, Konstantyn. <i>Ukraine and Russia: A History of the Economic Relations between Ukraine and Russia, 1654–1917</i> (Marquette University Press 1958) <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.questia.com/read/30412054/ukraine-and-russia-a-history-of-the-economic-relations">online</a></li> 
        <li>Luckyj, George S. <i>Towards an Intellectual History of Ukraine: An Anthology of Ukrainian Thought from 1710 to 1995.</i> (1996)</li> 
        <li><a href="/wiki/Magocsi,_Paul_Robert" class="mw-redirect" title="Magocsi, Paul Robert">Magocsi, Paul Robert</a>, <i>A History of Ukraine</i>. <a href="/wiki/University_of_Toronto_Press" title="University of Toronto Press">University of Toronto Press</a>, 1996 
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-8020-7820-6" title="Special:BookSources/0-8020-7820-6">0-8020-7820-6</a></li> 
        <li>Reid, Anna. <i>Borderland: A Journey Through the History of Ukraine</i> (2003) <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.questia.com/read/96969196/borderland-a-journey-through-the-history-of-ukraine">online edition</a></li> 
        <li><a href="/wiki/Orest_Subtelny" title="Orest Subtelny">Subtelny, Orest</a>. <i>Ukraine: A History</i>, 1st edition. Toronto: <a href="/wiki/University_of_Toronto_Press" title="University of Toronto Press">University of Toronto Press</a>, 1988. 
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-8020-8390-0" title="Special:BookSources/0-8020-8390-0">0-8020-8390-0</a>.</li> 
        <li>Yekelchyk, Serhy. <i>Ukraine: Birth of a Modern Nation</i> (Oxford University Press 2007) <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.questia.com/read/117724172/ukraine-birth-of-a-modern-nation">online</a></li>
       </ul> 
      </div> 
      <h4><span class="mw-headline" id="World_War_II_2">World War II</span></h4> 
      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1004355016">
      <div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em"> 
       <ul>
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBoshyk1986" class="citation book cs1">Boshyk, Yuri (1986). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/ukraineduringwor0000unse"><i>Ukraine During World War II: History and Its Aftermath</i></a></span>. Canadian Institute of Ukrainian Studies. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-920862-37-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-920862-37-7"><bdi>978-0-920862-37-7</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Ukraine+During+World+War+II%3A+History+and+Its+Aftermath&amp;rft.pub=Canadian+Institute+of+Ukrainian+Studies&amp;rft.date=1986&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-920862-37-7&amp;rft.aulast=Boshyk&amp;rft.aufirst=Yuri&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fukraineduringwor0000unse&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUkraine" class="Z3988"></span></li> 
        <li>Berkhoff, Karel C. <i>Harvest of Despair: Life and Death in Ukraine Under Nazi Rule.</i> Harvard U. Press, 2004. 448 pp.</li> 
        <li>
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFCliff1984" class="citation book cs1">Cliff, Tony (1984). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/classstrugglewom0000clif"><i>Class Struggle and Women's Liberation</i></a></span>. Bookmarks. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-906224-12-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-906224-12-0"><bdi>978-0-906224-12-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Class+Struggle+and+Women%27s+Liberation&amp;rft.pub=Bookmarks&amp;rft.date=1984&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-906224-12-0&amp;rft.aulast=Cliff&amp;rft.aufirst=Tony&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fclassstrugglewom0000clif&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AUkraine" class="Z3988"></span></li> 
        <li>Gross, Jan T. <i>Revolution from Abroad: The Soviet Conquest of Poland's Western Ukraine and Western Belorussia</i> (1988).</li> 
        <li><a href="/wiki/Wendy_Lower" title="Wendy Lower">Lower, Wendy</a>. <i>Nazi Empire-Building and the Holocaust in Ukraine.</i> U. of North Carolina Press, 2005. 307 pp.</li> 
        <li>Piotrowski Tadeusz, <i>Poland's Holocaust: Ethnic Strife, Collaboration with Occupying Forces and Genocide in the Second Republic, 1918–1947</i>, McFarland &amp; Company, 1998, 
         <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-7864-0371-3" title="Special:BookSources/0-7864-0371-3">0-7864-0371-3</a></li> 
        <li>Redlich, Shimon. <i>Together and Apart in Brzezany: Poles, Jews, and Ukrainians, 1919–1945.</i> Indiana U. Press, 2002. 202 pp.</li> 
        <li>Zabarko, Boris, ed. <i>Holocaust In The Ukraine</i>, Mitchell Vallentine &amp; Co, 2005. 394 pp.</li>
       </ul>

              <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">History</th>
              <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">

                 <li><a href="/wiki/Russian_Empire" title="Russian Empire">Russian Empire</a></li> 
                 <li><a href="/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union">Soviet Union</a></li> 
                 <li><a href="/wiki/Dissolution_of_the_Soviet_Union" title="Dissolution of the Soviet Union">Dissolution of the Soviet Union</a></li> 
                 <li><a href="/wiki/Union_of_Sovereign_States" class="mw-redirect" title="Union of Sovereign States">Union of Sovereign States</a></li> 
                 <li><a href="/wiki/Belavezha_Accords" class="mw-redirect" title="Belavezha Accords">Belavezha Accords</a></li> 
                 <li><a href="/wiki/Alma-Ata_Protocol" title="Alma-Ata Protocol">Alma-Ata Protocol</a></li> 
                 <li><a href="/wiki/CIS_Charter" title="CIS Charter">CIS Charter</a></li>
                </ul> 
               </div></td>
             </tr>
            </tbody>
           </table>
           <div></div></td>
          <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="5" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px">

           </div></td>
         </tr>

         <tr>
          <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;">
           <div>
            <div class="plainlist">
             <ul>
              <li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li>
              <li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li>
             </ul>
